thread.title: A carry-on that stands up to the TSA and Motörhead
thread.title_full: A carry-on that stands up to the TSA and Motörhead

author: eTN Editor
title: A carry-on that stands up to the TSA and Motörhead
text:
A carry-on that stands up to the TSA and Motörhead 
Now you can go through security without removing electronics from your bags. 
When a little known outfit called ecbc claimed to have designed a carry-on bag that would breeze my electronics through security without unpacking, I was skeptical. Gadgets that purport to make TSA screening easier for business travelers frequently cross my desk, so I confess that my eyes glazed over when I received this pitch. But the possibility was so enticing that I found myself clicking back, albeit with my bullshit detector prudently engaged. The website described their FastPass system as a zip-open compartment of padded pockets contoured to keep a computer, tablet, phone and all their attendant cables, peripherals, even an auxiliary power pack ‘fiercely protected’ but still visible for security. 
But it wasn’t until I noticed the company’s ‘test drive’ offer --- take delivery, pack your stuff, wheel it around your house (no flying, skiing, or road trips of course) and if you’re disappointed, send the suitcase back within 30 days for a full refund, shipping included --- that I surrendered to my curiosity. The tough ballistic bag that arrived was smart looking, smooth rolling, and at 22 inches, roomy enough for a midweek business trip yet easy to hoist into an overhead bin. Still, I’m a doubter where luggage is concerned, and it was only after I managed to fit my entire array of electronics into the nest of compartments that I decided to give this bag the crucial airport test. Oct 22, 2015
